com.ausinformatics.overrun.client

Interface ClientLibrary.ClientInterface

  • Enclosing class:
    ClientLibrary

    public static interface ClientLibrary.ClientInterface
    The client interface. You must implement this class for your bot to actually function (since the ClientLibrary determines through reflection the name of your class).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ClientLibrary.ClientInterface.Constants
      A set of helpful constants

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clientDoTurn()
      This function is called when it is your turn to play.

    • Method Detail

      • clientRegister

        void clientRegister()
        This function is called when your client connects to the server.

        You need to provide a name using ClientLibrary.setName(String), and optionally choose a colour using ClientLibrary.setColour(int, int, int)

        clientRegister() must return within 1 second.

      • clientInit

        void clientInit(int playerCount,
              int boardSize,
              int playerId)
        This is called when a game is about to begin.

        You are not required to make any calls in this function.

        Parameters:
        playerCount - The number of players in this game
        boardSize - The length of the side of the board (The board will be square.)
        playerId - Your player ID. Your base has a type of -playerId (see clientTerrainInfo(int, int, int))

        This function must return within 1 second

      • clientMoneyInfo

        void clientMoneyInfo(int pid,
                   int moneyCount)
        This function is called once per player currently alive, before your turn begins.

        You are not required to make any calls in this function

        Parameters:
        pid - The player being reported
        moneyCount - How much money the player currently has banked

        This function must return within 1 second

      • clientTerrainInfo

        void clientTerrainInfo(int x,
                     int y,
                     int type)
        This function is called once per square on the map, before you take your turn.

        You are not required to make any calls in this function.

        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the square being reported
        y - The y coordinate of the square being reported
        type - The type of this terrain.
        ValueType
        0Blank square
        ClientLibrary.ClientInterface.Constants.WALLA wall
        n, n < 0 The home base of player -n. If -n is your ID, this is your base
        x, x > 0 A square with x resources

        This function will not ever be called with any information about the units on the map. This function must return within 1 second.

      • clientDroneLocation

        void clientDroneLocation(int pid,
                       int id,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int numCans)
        This function is called once per unit on the map, before your turn.

        You are not required to call anything from this function.

        Parameters:
        pid - The ID of the player who owns this unit
        id - The ID of this unit. The pair (pId, id) is guaranteed to be unique across the game, however (id) itself is not.
        x - The x value of the square this unit sits on
        y - The y value of the square this unit sits on
        numCans - The number of cans this drone has in its stock.

        This function must return within 1 second

      • clientDoTurn

        void clientDoTurn()
        This function is called when it is your turn to play.

        You are not required to call anything from this function, but it is strongly suggested that you call some combination of ClientLibrary.move(int, int), ClientLibrary.build(int), ClientLibrary.getCost(int), and ClientLibrary.getCans(int) from within this function.

        This function must return within 2 seconds
